text: VivoCity Station is a great way to get to Sentosa island. The monorail runs frequently so the wait is not long at all. The monorail is clean and spacious and the views and experience overall was great!

Convenient to take Monorail to Sentosa Island with a total of 3 stops.

Resorts World Station to get to Adventure Cove Waterpark, Universal Studio and Sea Aquarium.

Imbiah station (which is a walking distance from Resorts World St) to get to Imbiah lookout, Merlion cable and Sensoryscape.

Beach station to get to beaches and transfer hub.

Exploring the beauty of Sentosa Island via the Vivocity Monorail was a highlight of my trip to Singapore. While the queues for the monorail could be lengthy at times, the anticipation of embarking on a new adventure made the wait worthwhile. As the monorail glided across the water towards Sentosa Island, I was treated to breathtaking views of the Singapore skyline and the sparkling sea below. The journey was not just a means of transportation, but an experience in itselfâ€”a chance to marvel at the city's architectural wonders and natural beauty from a unique vantage poi, though be prepared for potentially long queues. Alternatively, consider taking the affordable SGD 1 bus from the Vivocity bus stop to Sentosa Resorts World parking area for a smoother journey.

One of the way to visit sentosa island. You need to pay 4$ per person, and the return trip is free. Its located in the 4th floor of the mall. You can also bought attraction tickets for sentosa in this station

VivoCity is a popular shopping mall in Singapore. It is located near HarbourFront MRT Station, providing easy access for visitors. The mall offers a wide range of retail stores, dining options, entertainment facilities, and even a rooftop Sky Park with stunning views of Sentosa Island and the Singapore skyline.
